paragraphs.body: Slang refers to terms that are commonly used in everyday language but not considered official words, including exclamations and non-traditional insults. There are several types of slang in the ${link_0} and, as with all languages, it changes over the course of time.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
paragraphs.text: Slang refers to terms that are commonly used in everyday language but not considered official words, including exclamations and non-traditional insults. There are several types of slang in the World of Avatar and, as with all languages, it changes over the course of time.

paragraphs.body: Ash maker – An insult used by the ${link_0} in reference to the citizens of the Fire Nation, even those with mixed heritage, such as ${link_1}.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Ash maker – An insult used by the Freedom Fighters in reference to the citizens of the Fire Nation, even those with mixed heritage, such as Kori Morishita.

paragraphs.body: Bite us in the blubber – A term used to indicate that a specific action will have consequences later on, or the equivalent of "come back to haunt us". ${link_0} said this to ${link_1} when the ${link_2} rudely told ${link_3} off.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Bite us in the blubber – A term used to indicate that a specific action will have consequences later on, or the equivalent of "come back to haunt us". Sokka said this to Aang when the Avatar rudely told Joo Dee off.

paragraphs.body: Bleeding hog monkeys  – An expletive used by the ${link_0} when he sees ${link_1} abscond with his ship. A varied form of "flying hog monkeys".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Bleeding hog monkeys  – An expletive used by the pirate captain when he sees Team Avatar abscond with his ship. A varied form of "flying hog monkeys".

paragraphs.body: Blockhead – An insult intended to imply stupidity - see also meat head. It was used by Toph to describe ${link_0}'s inability to learn ${link_1}.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Blockhead – An insult intended to imply stupidity - see also meat head. It was used by Toph to describe Bolin's inability to learn metalbending.

paragraphs.body: Blowhard – A term used by Sokka to describe a boring ${link_0}.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Blowhard – A term used by Sokka to describe a boring professor.

paragraphs.body: Bozo – An insult used by ${link_0} when battling the ${link_1}.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Bozo – An insult used by Katara when battling the Rough Rhinos.

paragraphs.body: Chattering hog-monkey – Used to indicate excessive or unnecessary talking. Katara called Sokka this when he kept shouting unneeded ${link_0} advice at her.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Chattering hog-monkey – Used to indicate excessive or unnecessary talking. Katara called Sokka this when he kept shouting unneeded waterbending advice at her.

paragraphs.body: Colony trash – An insult directed at ${link_0} who live in the ${link_1}. It was used by ${link_2} to insult Aang, who enrolled under the alias of Kuzon as a Fire Nation colonial in a ${link_3} on the mainland.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Colony trash – An insult directed at Fire Nation colonists who live in the Earth Kingdom. It was used by Hide to insult Aang, who enrolled under the alias of Kuzon as a Fire Nation colonial in a school on the mainland.

paragraphs.body: Dancy Pants – A term used by ${link_0} to refer to Aang's dancing.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Dancy Pants – A term used by Toph to refer to Aang's dancing.

paragraphs.body: Dirt people – A Fire Nation insult directed at people with Earth Kingdom heritage, especially earthbenders. It was used by Master ${link_0} to insult Toph Beifong, and later on, in an official complaint issued by him.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Dirt people – A Fire Nation insult directed at people with Earth Kingdom heritage, especially earthbenders. It was used by Master Kunyo to insult Toph Beifong, and later on, in an official complaint issued by him.

paragraphs.body: Dunderhead – A mild insult used by Aang when referring to Toph's stubborn nature. Synonymous with less rude insults such as "idiot" and "stupid-head". Toph herself used this term to refer to Master ${link_0} and ${link_1} after she escaped their metal prison.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Dunderhead – A mild insult used by Aang when referring to Toph's stubborn nature. Synonymous with less rude insults such as "idiot" and "stupid-head". Toph herself used this term to refer to Master Yu and Xin Fu after she escaped their metal prison.

paragraphs.body: Earthiness – A term used by Aang to refer to ${link_0} ${link_1}. It is the equivalent of "majesty".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Earthiness – A term used by Aang to refer to Earth King Kuei. It is the equivalent of "majesty".

paragraphs.body: Fancy fingers – A pejorative term for someone who is overly refined. When Toph claimed that Team Avatar does not have the manners to blend in with the upper class of ${link_0}, Katara fired back that Toph was not exactly "lady fancy fingers".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Fancy fingers – A pejorative term for someone who is overly refined. When Toph claimed that Team Avatar does not have the manners to blend in with the upper class of Ba Sing Se, Katara fired back that Toph was not exactly "lady fancy fingers".

paragraphs.body: Fatso – A derogatory term usually reserved for overweight people. Used by Azula when referring to her uncle ${link_0} as "Uncle Fatso".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Fatso – A derogatory term usually reserved for overweight people. Used by Azula when referring to her uncle Iroh as "Uncle Fatso".

paragraphs.body: Fieriness – A form of Earthiness used to refer to the Fire Lord.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Fieriness – A form of Earthiness used to refer to the Fire Lord.

paragraphs.body: Fire tosser – A term used during the ${link_0} to refer to those with control over the element of fire, predating the term ${link_1}. It was used by the ${link_2} to describe a group of men who had departed from their ${link_3} and were behaving disrespectfully toward nature and violent to the spirits with whom they came into contact.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Fire tosser – A term used during the era of Raava to refer to those with control over the element of fire, predating the term firebender. It was used by the aye-aye spirit to describe a group of men who had departed from their lion turtle and were behaving disrespectfully toward nature and violent to the spirits with whom they came into contact.

paragraphs.body: Flameo – A term that has several definitions, depending on the context, including "hello", "goodbye", and "great". It was used by Aang while attending a Fire Nation school, much to the confusion and amusement of others. Used before the ${link_0}, the term had fallen out of everyday use by 100 ${link_1}, but it eventually resurfaced, though by 171 AG, the meaning had changed to be that of a mild swear, used to convey surprise and shock.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Flameo – A term that has several definitions, depending on the context, including "hello", "goodbye", and "great". It was used by Aang while attending a Fire Nation school, much to the confusion and amusement of others. Used before the Hundred Year War, the term had fallen out of everyday use by 100 AG, but it eventually resurfaced, though by 171 AG, the meaning had changed to be that of a mild swear, used to convey surprise and shock.

paragraphs.body: Flying hog monkeys – A phrase used by many members of Team Avatar in unpleasant or unlucky situations.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Flying hog monkeys – A phrase used by many members of Team Avatar in unpleasant or unlucky situations.

paragraphs.body: Flying fire ferrets – A phrase used by Satoru when struck with an idea. Comparable with "egad!" and "eureka" in context.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Flying fire ferrets – A phrase used by Satoru when struck with an idea. Comparable with "egad!" and "eureka" in context.

paragraphs.body: Gasbag – A word used to refer to someone who talks too much. Zuko described his uncle, ${link_0}, and an ${link_1} member as such when they were talking among each other and Zuko could not discern the meaning of their conversation.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Gasbag – A word used to refer to someone who talks too much. Zuko described his uncle, Iroh, and an Order of the White Lotus member as such when they were talking among each other and Zuko could not discern the meaning of their conversation.

paragraphs.body: Glow it up – A phrase used to refer to going into the ${link_0}.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Glow it up – A phrase used to refer to going into the Avatar State.

paragraphs.body: Gumflapper – A similar term to "gasbag", this word was used by Toph when referring to Bolin after he would not stop talking.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Gumflapper – A similar term to "gasbag", this word was used by Toph when referring to Bolin after he would not stop talking.

paragraphs.body: Hotman – A term for someone from the Fire Nation or the equivalent of "sir". Aang used this term to address strangers until he realized it was drawing attention. The generic term became outdated by 100 AG. He later called Zuko "Sifu Hotman", much to the firebender's dismay.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Hotman – A term for someone from the Fire Nation or the equivalent of "sir". Aang used this term to address strangers until he realized it was drawing attention. The generic term became outdated by 100 AG. He later called Zuko "Sifu Hotman", much to the firebender's dismay.

paragraphs.body: Hoodlum – A pejorative term referring to someone who generally flouts the law. Korra referred to a waterbending member of the ${link_0} as a hoodlum when she saw them extorting money from a shopkeeper.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Hoodlum – A pejorative term referring to someone who generally flouts the law. Korra referred to a waterbending member of the Triple Threat Triad as a hoodlum when she saw them extorting money from a shopkeeper.

paragraphs.body: Hullabaloo – A term used by Aang's ${link_0} at the Fire Nation school to refer to Aang's dancing while playing the ${link_1}.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Hullabaloo – A term used by Aang's music teacher at the Fire Nation school to refer to Aang's dancing while playing the tsungi horn.

paragraphs.body: Jerkbending – A term used by Sokka as a synonym for firebending to express his dislike for the bending art.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Jerkbending – A term used by Sokka as a synonym for firebending to express his dislike for the bending art.

paragraphs.body: Kingliness – A term used by Sokka to refer to Earth King Kuei. Like earthiness, it is the equivalent of "majesty".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Kingliness – A term used by Sokka to refer to Earth King Kuei. Like earthiness, it is the equivalent of "majesty".

paragraphs.body: Legit – Short for "legitimate".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Legit – Short for "legitimate".

paragraphs.body: Lily livers – An insult used by Toph on her ${link_0} students. It is the equivalent of "yellow-bellied".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Lily livers – An insult used by Toph on her metalbending students. It is the equivalent of "yellow-bellied".

paragraphs.body: Loudmouth – An insult used by Toph to describe Sokka's openness about killing the ${link_0} in the Fire Nation fishing village, ${link_1}.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Loudmouth – An insult used by Toph to describe Sokka's openness about killing the Fire Lord in the Fire Nation fishing village, Jang Hui.

paragraphs.body: Meat head – An insult used to imply someone's stupidity. It was used by Katara to refer to Aang and Sokka who wished to take the easy way out of a situation.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Meat head – An insult used to imply someone's stupidity. It was used by Katara to refer to Aang and Sokka who wished to take the easy way out of a situation.

paragraphs.body: Monkey feathers – An obscenity used by Aang when events are not favorable. Variations include "double monkey feathers" and "monkey feathers on top of monkey feathers".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Monkey feathers – An obscenity used by Aang when events are not favorable. Variations include "double monkey feathers" and "monkey feathers on top of monkey feathers".

paragraphs.body: Northie – A derogatory term that refers to citizens of the ${link_0}. During the ${link_1}, Northie was used in Southern propaganda, such as in the ${link_2} theme song.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Northie – A derogatory term that refers to citizens of the Northern Water Tribe. During the Water Tribe Civil War, Northie was used in Southern propaganda, such as in the Nuktuk theme song.

paragraphs.body: Nut brained – An insult with the equivalent of "stupid". Katara used it while yelling at her brother.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Nut brained – An insult with the equivalent of "stupid". Katara used it while yelling at her brother.

paragraphs.body: One trick poodle pony – A person or thing that is limited to a single skill. Bolin stated to ${link_0} and ${link_1} that ${link_2} was "not just a one trick poodle pony" after the latter chewed through the ropes tying up the ${link_3}. It is the equivalent of "one trick pony".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: One trick poodle pony – A person or thing that is limited to a single skill. Bolin stated to Korra and Mako that Pabu was "not just a one trick poodle pony" after the latter chewed through the ropes tying up the Fire Ferrets. It is the equivalent of "one trick pony".

paragraphs.body: Oogies – A term equivalent to "yuck" or "gross". It was frequently used by Sokka in the events surrounding the ${link_0} in reference to Aang and Katara's romance. Toph compared it to licking someone's hand.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Oogies – A term equivalent to "yuck" or "gross". It was frequently used by Sokka in the events surrounding the Harmony Restoration Movement in reference to Aang and Katara's romance. Toph compared it to licking someone's hand.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} – A term used to indicate someone is in trouble with another person, with the implication being that they must be forgiven in order to leave said place. It was used by ${link_1} to tell Bolin that she had forgiven him after his involvement with ${link_2}'s ${link_3} put a strain on their relationship.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Polar bear doghouse – A term used to indicate someone is in trouble with another person, with the implication being that they must be forgiven in order to leave said place. It was used by Opal to tell Bolin that she had forgiven him after his involvement with Kuvira's army put a strain on their relationship.

paragraphs.body: Rinky-dink town – A term used by Sokka to refer to towns in need.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Rinky-dink town – A term used by Sokka to refer to towns in need.

paragraphs.body: Shut your airhole – The equivalent of "shut your mouth" or "shut up".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Shut your airhole – The equivalent of "shut your mouth" or "shut up".

paragraphs.body: Sitting turtle duck – The equivalent of being a "sitting duck". Bolin used this term to refer to Korra's flat-footed stance while teaching her the ${link_0} style of ${link_1}.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Sitting turtle duck – The equivalent of being a "sitting duck". Bolin used this term to refer to Korra's flat-footed stance while teaching her the pro-bending style of earthbending.

paragraphs.body: Snoozles – A term used to refer to someone who is either sleepy or still asleep. It was used by Toph to describe Sokka when he complained that her and Aang's ${link_0} was depriving him of further sleep.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Snoozles – A term used to refer to someone who is either sleepy or still asleep. It was used by Toph to describe Sokka when he complained that her and Aang's earthbending training was depriving him of further sleep.

paragraphs.body: Snow savages – A Fire Nation insult directed at ${link_0} members. It was used by Master Kunyo to describe Sokka in an official complaint.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Snow savages – A Fire Nation insult directed at Water Tribe members. It was used by Master Kunyo to describe Sokka in an official complaint.

paragraphs.body: Stay flaming – The equivalent of "stay cool" in the Fire Nation. Used primarily before the Hundred Year War, it was outdated by 100 AG.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Stay flaming – The equivalent of "stay cool" in the Fire Nation. Used primarily before the Hundred Year War, it was outdated by 100 AG.

paragraphs.body: Sugar Queen – Another slang term used by Toph. Depending on the tone in which it is said, its meaning varies from an insult to a term of endearment with a mildly mocking connotation. Usually it means "goodie-two-shoes" or "know it all". A variation is "sweetness".
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Sugar Queen – Another slang term used by Toph. Depending on the tone in which it is said, its meaning varies from an insult to a term of endearment with a mildly mocking connotation. Usually it means "goodie-two-shoes" or "know it all". A variation is "sweetness".

paragraphs.body: Sweet sugar cakes – Similar to the word "babe", it was used by ${link_0} to address ${link_1} during ${link_2}'s party while teaching the ${link_3} how to get boys to like her.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Sweet sugar cakes – Similar to the word "babe", it was used by Ty Lee to address Azula during Chan's party while teaching the princess how to get boys to like her.

paragraphs.body: Twinkle Toes/Fancy Dancer – Terms used by Toph to describe Aang being light on his feet.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Twinkle Toes/Fancy Dancer – Terms used by Toph to describe Aang being light on his feet.

paragraphs.body: Working my arrow off – A phrase of ${link_0} origin, it refers to the ${link_1} master ${link_2}. It means to work hard; Aang used it to indicate to Sokka that he had been training very hard, and thus deserved some time off.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Working my arrow off – A phrase of Air Nomad origin, it refers to the airbending master tattoos. It means to work hard; Aang used it to indicate to Sokka that he had been training very hard, and thus deserved some time off.

paragraphs.body: Yip yip – A term equivalent to "go" or "giddy up". It is used to command a ${link_0} to fly.
section: Slang in the World of Avatar
Terms
paragraphs.text: Yip yip – A term equivalent to "go" or "giddy up". It is used to command a flying bison to fly.

source.title: Slang in the World of Avatar
